CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 27, 1952, pg. 3, reads: "Celebrates 106th Birthday - Friends and neighbors, white and colored, of Mrs. Sabra Washington, gathered in her home last Saturday afternoon to celebrate her 106th birthday. Mrs. Washington, who was born in slavery, was a good-sized girl when the Civil War ended.  Her birthday party is made an annual event by her Brushton neighbors. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of three women, including former slave Sabre "Mother" Washington wearing sweater, striped skirt, and hair net, seated in leaf patterned chair, during her 106th birthday party in her home on Conemaugh Street
